# drawPackedGlyphs(_:at:)

**Type Method**

Draws a set of packed glyphs at the specified point in the current coordinate system.

## Declaration

```swift
class func drawPackedGlyphs(_ packedGlyphs: UnsafePointer<CChar>, at point: NSPoint)
```

## Parameters

- **packedGlyphs**: A C-style array containing one or more `CGGlyph` data types terminated by a `NULL` character.
- **point**: The starting point at which to draw the glyphs.

## Discussion

This method draws the glyphs immediately.

You should avoid using this method directly. Instead, use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBezierPath/appendGlyph(_:in:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBezierPath/appendGlyphs(_:count:in:)] methods to create a path with one or more glyphs.

## Related Documentation

- **appendPackedGlyphs(_:)**: Appends an array of packed glyphs to the path.
- **set()**: Sets the color of subsequent drawing to the color that the color object represents.

## Drawing a Path

- **stroke()**: Draws a line along the path using the current stroke color and drawing attributes.
- **fill()**: Paints the region enclosed by the path.
- **fill(_:)**: Fills the specified rectangular path with the current fill color.
- **stroke(_:)**: Strokes the path of the specified rectangle using the current stroke color and the default drawing attributes.
- **strokeLine(from:to:)**: Strokes a line between two points using the current stroke color and the default drawing attributes.
